info: This document describes objects that may be used when communicating with signald.

ListenerState.doc: indicates when the incoming connection to the signal server has started or stopped

type.doc: the type of object to expect in the `data` field

version.doc: the version of the object in the `data` field

data.doc: the incoming object. The structure will vary from message to message, see `type` and `version` fields

error.doc: true if the incoming message represents an error

ClientMessageWrapper.doc: Wraps all incoming messages after a v1 subscribe request is issued

AcceptInvitationRequest.doc: Accept a v2 group invitation. Note that you must have a profile name set to join groups.

avatar.doc: path to the group's avatar on local disk, if available

accessControl.doc: current access control settings for this group

members.doc: list of requesting members to approve

ApproveMembershipRequest.doc: approve a request to join a group

revision.doc: the latest known revision, default value (-1) forces fetch from server

GetGroupRequest.doc: Query the server for the latest state of a known group. If no account in signald is a member of the group (anymore), an error with error_type: 'UnknownGroupException' is returned.

GetLinkedDevicesRequest.doc: list all linked devices on a Signal account

JoinGroupRequest.doc: Join a group using the a signal.group URL. Note that you must have a profile name set to join groups.

addFromInviteLink.doc: The access level required in order to join the group from the invite link, as an AccessControl.AccessRequired enum from the upstream Signal groups.proto file. This is UNSATISFIABLE (4) when the group link is disabled; ADMINISTRATOR (3) when the group link is enabled, but an administrator must approve new members; and ANY (1) when the group link is enabled and no approval is required. See theGroupAccessControl structure and the upstream enum ordinals.

revision.doc: The Group V2 revision. This is incremented by clients whenever they update group information, and it is often used by clients to determine if the local group state is out-of-date with the server's revision.

pendingAdminApproval.doc: Whether the account is waiting for admin approval in order to be added to the group.

deviceId.doc: the ID of the device to unlink

RemoveLinkedDeviceRequest.doc: Remove a linked device from the Signal account. Only allowed when the local device id is 1

account.doc: The identifier of the account to interact with

groupID.doc: the ID of the group to update

description.doc: A new group description. Set to empty string to remove an existing description.

updateAccessControl.doc: note that only one of the access controls may be updated per request

resetLink.doc: regenerate the group link password, invalidating the old one

UpdateGroupRequest.doc: modify a group. Note that only one modification action may be performed at once

GroupInfo.doc: A generic type that is used when the group version is not known

account.doc: The phone number of the account to use

name.doc: New profile name. Set to empty string for no profile name

avatarFile.doc: Path to new profile avatar file. If unset or null, unset the profile avatar

about.doc: an optional about string. If unset, null or an empty string will unset profile about field

emoji.doc: an optional single emoji character. If unset, null or an empty string will unset profile emoji

mobilecoin_address.doc: an optional *base64-encoded* MobileCoin address to set in the profile. Note that this is not the traditional MobileCoin address encoding, which is custom. Clients are responsible for converting between MobileCoin's custom base58 on the user-facing side and base64 encoding on the signald side. If unset, null or an empty string, will empty the profile payment address

ResolveAddressRequest.doc: Resolve a partial JsonAddress with only a number or UUID to one with both. Anywhere that signald accepts a JsonAddress will except a partial, this is a convenience function for client authors, mostly because signald doesn't resolve all the partials it returns

number.doc: An e164 phone number, starting with +. Currently the only available user-facing Signal identifier.

uuid.doc: A UUID, the unique identifier for a particular Signal account.

to.doc: The address that sent the message being marked as read

timestamps.doc: List of messages to mark as read

async.doc: if true, return results from local store immediately, refreshing from server in the background if needed. if false (default), block until profile can be retrieved from server

GetProfileRequest.doc: Get all information available about a user

name.doc: The user's name from local contact names if available, or if not in contact list their Signal profile name

avatar.doc: path to avatar on local disk

color.doc: color of the chat with this user

mobilecoin_address.doc: *base64-encoded* mobilecoin address. Note that this is not the traditional MobileCoin address encoding. Clients are responsible for converting between MobileCoin's custom base58 on the user-facing side and base64 encoding on the signald side. If unset, null or an empty string, will empty the profile payment address

async.doc: return results from local store immediately, refreshing from server afterward if needed. If false (default), block until all pending profiles have been retrieved.

member_role.doc: The role of all members other than the group creator. Options are ADMINISTRATOR or DEFAULT (case insensitive)

server.doc: The identifier of the server to use. Leave blank for default (usually Signal production servers but configurable at build time)

GenerateLinkingURIRequest.doc: Generate a linking URI. Typically this is QR encoded and scanned by the primary device. Submit the returned session_id with a finish_link request.

FinishLinkRequest.doc: After a linking URI has been requested, finish_link must be called with the session_id provided with the URI. it will return information about the new account once the linking process is completed by the other device.

device_id.doc: The Signal device ID. Official Signal mobile clients (iPhone and Android) have device ID = 1, while linked devices such as Signal Desktop or Signal iPad have higher device IDs.

account_id.doc: The primary identifier on the account, included with all requests to signald for this account. Previously called 'username'

uri.doc: the tsdevice:/ uri provided (typically in qr code form) by the new device

AddLinkedDeviceRequest.doc: Link a new device to a local Signal account

account.doc: the e164 phone number to register with

voice.doc: set to true to request a voice call instead of an SMS for verification

server.doc: The identifier of the server to use. Leave blank for default (usually Signal production servers but configurable at build time)

RegisterRequest.doc: begin the account registration process by requesting a phone number verification code. when the code is received, submit it with a verify request

account.doc: the e164 phone number being verified

VerifyRequest.doc: verify an account's phone number with a code after registering, completing the account creation process

GetIdentitiesRequest.doc: Get information about a known keys for a particular address

IdentityKeyList.doc: a list of identity keys associated with a particular address

address.doc: The user to query identity keys for

qr_code_data.doc: base64-encoded QR code data. required if safety_number is absent

trust_level.doc: One of TRUSTED_UNVERIFIED, TRUSTED_VERIFIED or UNTRUSTED. Default is TRUSTED_VERIFIED

TrustRequest.doc: Trust another user's safety number using either the QR code data or the safety number text

server.doc: delete account information from the server as well (default false)

DeleteAccountRequest.doc: delete all account data signald has on disk, and optionally delete the account from the server as well. Note that this is not "unlink" and will delete the entire account, even from a linked device.

TypingRequest.doc: send a typing started or stopped message

address.doc: the user to reset session with

ResetSessionRequest.doc: reset a session with a particular user

RequestSyncRequest.doc: Request other devices on the account send us their group list, syncable config and contact list.

GroupLinkInfoRequest.doc: Get information about a group from a signal.group link

UpdateContactRequest.doc: update information about a local contact

SetExpirationRequest.doc: Set the message expiration timer for a thread. Expiration must be specified in seconds, set to 0 to disable timer

account.doc: The account to set the device name of

SetDeviceNameRequest.doc: set this device's name. This will show up on the mobile device on the same account under

account.doc: The account to subscribe to incoming message for

SubscribeRequest.doc: receive incoming messages. After making a subscribe request, incoming messages will be sent to the client encoded as ClientMessageWrapper. Send an unsubscribe request or disconnect from the socket to stop receiving messages.

address.doc: the address to send the delete message to. should match address the message to be deleted was sent to. required if group is not set.

group.doc: the group to send the delete message to. should match group the message to be deleted was sent to. required if address is not set.

AddServerRequest.doc: add a new server to connect to. Returns the new server's UUID.

address.doc: the address to send the payment message to

account.doc: The account to use to retrieve the remote config

RemoteConfigRequest.doc: Retrieves the remote config (feature flags) from the server.

timestamp.doc: the timestamp that the message was sent at, according to the sender's device. This is used to uniquely identify this message for things like reactions and quotes.

attachments.doc: files attached to the incoming message

body.doc: the text body of the incoming message.

group.doc: if the incoming message was sent to a v1 group, information about that group will be here

groupV2.doc: if the incoming message was sent to a v2 group, basic identifying information about that group will be here. If group information changes, JsonGroupV2Info.revision is incremented. If the group revision is higher than previously seen, a client can retrieve the group information by calling get_group.

expiresInSeconds.doc: the expiry timer on the incoming message. Clients should delete records of the message within this number of seconds

quote.doc: if the incoming message is a quote or reply to another message, this will contain information about that message

contacts.doc: if the incoming message has a shared contact, the contact's information will be here

previews.doc: if the incoming message has a link preview, information about that preview will be here

sticker.doc: if the incoming message is a sticker, information about the sicker will be here

viewOnce.doc: indicates the message is a view once message. View once messages typically include no body and a single image attachment. Official Signal clients will prevent the user from saving the image, and once the user has viewed the image once they will destroy the image.

reaction.doc: if the message adds or removes a reaction to another message, this will indicate what change is being made

remoteDelete.doc: if the inbound message is deleting a previously sent message, indicates which message should be deleted

mentions.doc: list of mentions in the message

payment.doc: details about the MobileCoin payment attached to the message, if present

group_call_update.doc: the eraId string from a group call message update

id.doc: the client timestamp of the message being quoted

author.doc: the author of the message being quoted

text.doc: the body of the message being quoted

attachments.doc: list of files attached to the quoted message

mentions.doc: list of mentions in the quoted message

JsonQuote.doc: A quote is a reply to a previous message. ID is the sent time of the message being replied to

uuid.doc: The UUID of the account being mentioned

start.doc: The number of characters in that the mention starts at. Note that due to a quirk of how signald encodes JSON, if this value is 0 (for example if the first character in the message is the mention) the field won't show up.

length.doc: The length of the mention represented in the message. Seems to always be 1 but included here in case that changes.

remove.doc: set to true to remove the reaction. requires emoji be set to previously reacted emoji

targetAuthor.doc: the author of the message being reacted to

targetSentTimestamp.doc: the client timestamp of the message being reacted to

link.doc: UNSATISFIABLE when the group link is disabled, ADMINISTRATOR when the group link is enabled but an administrator must approve new members, ANY when the group link is enabled and no approval is required

GroupAccessControl.doc: group access control settings. Options for each controlled action are: UNKNOWN, ANY, MEMBER, ADMINISTRATOR, UNSATISFIABLE and UNRECOGNIZED

role.doc: possible values are: UNKNOWN, DEFAULT, ADMINISTRATOR and UNRECOGNIZED

added.doc: the first time this identity key was seen

trust_level.doc: One of TRUSTED_UNVERIFIED, TRUSTED_VERIFIED or UNTRUSTED

uuid.doc: A unique identifier for the server, referenced when adding accounts. Must be a valid UUID. Will be generated if not specified when creating.

receipt.doc: base64 encoded payment receipt data. This is a protobuf value which can be decoded as the Receipt object described in https://github.com/mobilecoinfoundation/mobilecoin/blob/master/api/proto/external.proto

name.doc: The name of this remote config entry. These names may be prefixed with the platform type ("android.", "ios.", "desktop.", etc.) Typically, clients only handle the relevant configs for its platform, hardcoding the names it cares about handling and ignoring the rest.

value.doc: The value for this remote config entry. Even though this is a string, it could be a boolean as a string, an integer/long value, a comma-delimited list, etc. Clients usually consume this by hardcoding the feature flagsit should track in the app and assuming that the server will send the type that the client expects. If an unexpected type occurs, it falls back to a default value.

timestamp.doc: the timestamp that the message was sent at, according to the sender's device. This is used to uniquely identify this message for things like reactions and quotes.

attachments.doc: files attached to the incoming message

body.doc: the text body of the incoming message.

group.doc: if the incoming message was sent to a v1 group, information about that group will be here

groupV2.doc: is the incoming message was sent to a v2 group, basic identifying information about that group will be here. For full information, use list_groups

expiresInSeconds.doc: the expiry timer on the incoming message. Clients should delete records of the message within this number of seconds

quote.doc: if the incoming message is a quote or reply to another message, this will contain information about that message

contacts.doc: if the incoming message has a shared contact, the contact's information will be here

previews.doc: if the incoming message has a link preview, information about that preview will be here

sticker.doc: if the incoming message is a sticker, information about the sicker will be here

viewOnce.doc: indicates the message is a view once message. View once messages typically include no body and a single image attachment. Official Signal clients will prevent the user from saving the image, and once the user has viewed the image once they will destroy the image.

reaction.doc: if the message adds or removes a reaction to another message, this will indicate what change is being made

remoteDelete.doc: if the inbound message is deleting a previously sent message, indicates which message should be deleted

mentions.doc: list of mentions in the message

avatar.doc: path to the group's avatar on local disk, if available

accessControl.doc: current access control settings for this group

id.doc: the client timestamp of the message being quoted

author.doc: the author of the message being quoted

text.doc: the body of the message being quoted

attachments.doc: list of files attached to the quoted message

mentions.doc: list of mentions in the quoted message

JsonQuote.doc: A quote is a reply to a previous message. ID is the sent time of the message being replied to

remove.doc: set to true to remove the reaction. requires emoji be set to previously reacted emoji

targetAuthor.doc: the author of the message being reacted to

targetSentTimestamp.doc: the client timestamp of the message being reacted to

uuid.doc: The UUID of the account being mentioned

start.doc: The number of characters in that the mention starts at. Note that due to a quirk of how signald encodes JSON, if this value is 0 (for example if the first character in the message is the mention) the field won't show up.

length.doc: The length of the mention represented in the message. Seems to always be 1 but included here in case that changes.

link.doc: UNSATISFIABLE when the group link is disabled, ADMINISTRATOR when the group link is enabled but an administrator must approve new members, ANY when the group link is enabled and no approval is required

GroupAccessControl.doc: group access control settings. Options for each controlled action are: UNKNOWN, ANY, MEMBER, ADMINISTRATOR, UNSATISFIABLE and UNRECOGNIZED

role.doc: possible values are: UNKNOWN, DEFAULT, ADMINISTRATOR and UNRECOGNIZED

accept_invitation.doc: Accept a v2 group invitation. Note that you must have a profile name set to join groups.

approve_membership.doc: approve a request to join a group

get_group.doc: Query the server for the latest state of a known group. If no account in signald is a member of the group (anymore), an error with error_type: 'UnknownGroupException' is returned.

get_linked_devices.doc: list all linked devices on a Signal account

join_group.doc: Join a group using the a signal.group URL. Note that you must have a profile name set to join groups.

remove_linked_device.doc: Remove a linked device from the Signal account. Only allowed when the local device id is 1

update_group.doc: modify a group. Note that only one modification action may be performed at once

resolve_address.doc: Resolve a partial JsonAddress with only a number or UUID to one with both. Anywhere that signald accepts a JsonAddress will except a partial, this is a convenience function for client authors, mostly because signald doesn't resolve all the partials it returns

get_profile.doc: Get all information available about a user

generate_linking_uri.doc: Generate a linking URI. Typically this is QR encoded and scanned by the primary device. Submit the returned session_id with a finish_link request.

finish_link.doc: After a linking URI has been requested, finish_link must be called with the session_id provided with the URI. it will return information about the new account once the linking process is completed by the other device.

add_device.doc: Link a new device to a local Signal account

register.doc: begin the account registration process by requesting a phone number verification code. when the code is received, submit it with a verify request

verify.doc: verify an account's phone number with a code after registering, completing the account creation process

get_identities.doc: Get information about a known keys for a particular address

trust.doc: Trust another user's safety number using either the QR code data or the safety number text

delete_account.doc: delete all account data signald has on disk, and optionally delete the account from the server as well. Note that this is not "unlink" and will delete the entire account, even from a linked device.

typing.doc: send a typing started or stopped message

reset_session.doc: reset a session with a particular user

request_sync.doc: Request other devices on the account send us their group list, syncable config and contact list.

group_link_info.doc: Get information about a group from a signal.group link

update_contact.doc: update information about a local contact

set_expiration.doc: Set the message expiration timer for a thread. Expiration must be specified in seconds, set to 0 to disable timer

set_device_name.doc: set this device's name. This will show up on the mobile device on the same account under

subscribe.doc: receive incoming messages. After making a subscribe request, incoming messages will be sent to the client encoded as ClientMessageWrapper. Send an unsubscribe request or disconnect from the socket to stop receiving messages.

add_server.doc: add a new server to connect to. Returns the new server's UUID.

get_remote_config.doc: Retrieves the remote config (feature flags) from the server.
